title: How to Cook Honey Glazed Parsnips
title_description: For those who don't want plain vegetables, try this to give your taste buds a reawakening, and make them dance with delight. Here is how to make yummy honey glazed parsnips (a root crop/tuber). Enjoy them hot or cold.

related_articles.title: How to Tell if an Avocado is Bad
How to Wash Fruit and Vegetables
How to Tell if an Avocado Is Ripe
How to Tell if a Kiwi Has Gone Bad

tips_warnings: Vegetable soup stock, makes a good base for combining vegetables and is a good accompaniment to side dishes.
Consider serving parsnips with spicy bean salad or sour cream.

Make a vegetable feast, a banquet. Here are some veggie dishes to consider including:

Vegetable terrine (baked as a casserole but served cold) with taco shells/chips and potato salad.
Try potato skins seasoned with a little mustard mixed with mayo. Or, make some roasted nuts for a garnish, and a vegetable omelet.
Carrots in nutmeg and orange or cinnamon glaze, or roasted pumpkin or butternut squash, roasted stuffed spicy vegetable peppers, or stuffed mushroom with leek cheese and herb crust.
Butternut squash and roasted mixed pepper soup, or roasted pumpkin, green chili peppers and red onion soup, French onion soup, or cream of mushroom soup.
Sweet facts, parsnips were previously used to extract sugar (sucrose) as were sugar beets, before sugar cane became the main source of table sugar.

steps.headline: Preheat oven to 160 C (320â„‰) degrees, for 15 minutes prior to cooking time.
Grease the roasting tray.
steps.description: Or, line it with aluminum foil, to keep juices from burning onto the pan.

steps.headline: Brush and wash parsnips.
steps.description: Remove the tops about 6mm (1/4 inch), with the leafy part -- and trim off any roots/and the very tip.

steps.headline: Slice the parsnips lengthwise: Most are shaped like carrots, but some are bulbous like turnips (either kind is creamy white but may have a purplish skin).
Put the slices in the center of the wire rack in a roasting tray.
Add other selected vegetables that you have cut into chunks.
steps.description: Spread other vegetables if desired around the parsnips on the wire rack that is in the roasting tray.

steps.headline: Turn the vegetables regularly during cooking to allow even heating without burning the vegetables.
Add salt and black pepper about 25 minutes into cooking.
Make the honey glaze.
steps.description: Warm the jar of honey in very hot water, then empty it into a bowl and stir in the butter or margarine.

steps.headline: Dribble the glaze from a spoon onto the vegetables to finish off the parsnips.
steps.description: It is nice to try different seasoning and spices combinations with dried herbs, fresh herbs, green onions, chives, chili's.
